ygData.subject: Re: Death of Lord Mistmoore
ygData.msgSnippet: Uhm, probably best to send directly to those who want to see (ie not to the whole list - some maybe using modems and not want a long download - my t3 won t
ygData.messageBody:
Uhm, probably best to send directly to those who want to see (ie not to the
whole list - some maybe using modems and not want a long download - my t3
won't notice but others will.)

Or post a url to a web page - I'd love to see them!

Snyak
Warrior of the 13th Level
Qeynos, Antonica 53226 visiting Freeport
Innoruuk
"The opinions expressed herein are my own and do not
necessarily reflect those of my Guild Master nor my Deity."


-----Original Message-----
From: mark mark [mailto:markerob@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 22, 1999 9:17 AM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Death of Lord Mistmoore

From: mark mark <markerob@...>

Sure, send them


>From: "Zwanenburg, John" <ZWANENJ@...>
>Reply-To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
>To: "'warriors_eq@onelist.com'" <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
>Subject: [warriors_eq] Death of Lord Mistmoore
>Date: Tue, 22 Jun 1999 09:08:44 -0400
>
>From: "Zwanenburg, John" <ZWANENJ@...>
>
>Hey all,
>
>
>Just wanted to share with you a sweet kill me and my
friends got last
>night.
>We were in Mistmoore and out came the lord himself. There
were 6 of us. A
>level 49 cleric. Level 43 warrior (Me) Level 47 Wizard,
level 47 Rogue,
>level 49 necro and a level 45 Ranger. We decided why the
heck not give him
>a
>try even tho he conned red to everyone in the party. Well
it was quite the
>battle. By far the craziest i have ever seen. In the end
only the Necro and
>the wizard were left but somehow they managed to pull it
off. I tried my
>best to stay in melee with him and was doing quite well
untill the cleric
>had a fizzle. But then it was ouch time. As soon as i went,
the Rogue was
>next and followed by the Ranger. The cleric somehow managed
to stay alive
>for a while longer but couldnt handle the beating. When i
finally made it
>back the necro was at 1 quarter life and the wozard half.
Talk about your
>kick ass battle, Ill never forget it. When my friend who
was just watching
>sends me the screens, would any one like them?
>
>Lothaniel/Rayne
>
> > ----------
> > From: suzkim@...[SMTP:suzkim@...]
> > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Sent: Tuesday, June 15, 1999 8:27 AM
> > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Warriors vs Hybrids
> >
> > From: suzkim@...
> >
> > Hi all,
> >
> > I wrote an e-mail to one of those guys from PPI - the
ones who do the
> > great
> > analysis works of classs (see eq-stratis cleric for a
sampling of their
> > work). I
> > told him of the things I have been reading here such as
a critical
>strike
> > (which
> > he didn't think would be accepted), increase what bind
wound could do (
>he
> > agreed that it should go up to 70-80%), increased skill
cap (no comment
> > from
> > him) and unique warrior skill (again no comment from
him). His idea was
> > to have
> > the warrior's defensives skill be increased some how.
That would make
>the
> > warrior harder to hit and therefore less damage and less
down time.
> >
> > I am going to try to get him to join this mailing list
since I feel he
> > could
> > give great insight. He did say that they were not going
to be writing
> > anything
> > soon but said something about how a warrior could be
tweeked to make a
> > warrior
> > awsome.
> >
> > Azlana
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
